result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Oden Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert Oden Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert Oden Jr was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Fine of $2,400.00 plus all  mandatory costs, penalties and surcharges, and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge.
To be paid by DOC out of up to 25% of prison funds IF APPLICABLE. Balance to be paid within one year of leaving HOC.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
To commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense DRiver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work, school and treatment only.

Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Oden Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Corrrected per clerical error, assessments corrected, and Due date/nonpayment penalty showing as should be. And due to clarification from clerk, changed from "doc collect" to "Clerk of Court" collect in CCAP.
Sent back to court, ? on DOC collect?

Defendant Robert Oden in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Robert Oden in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 2:  
On motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

Court ordered defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 127 days time served.  Huber privileges for work, school and treatment ONLY.  Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $2,400.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge.  Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 2 years.  Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 1 year to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.  

 - Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all fines, penalties, costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC, out of up to 25% prison funds, if applicable, any balance to be paid within 1 year of leaving the House of Correction.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Robert Oden in court with attorney Terese M. Dick appearing by telephone.  Defendant Robert Oden in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.  Defense counsel unavailable for today's proceedings.    Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Robert Oden not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Plea and sentencing.  Court in trial.    Case adjourned for Plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Robert Oden not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Projected guilty plea and sentencing.  Parties are still in need of test results.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Robert Oden not in court, in custody, not produced.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Oden in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Robert Oden in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM, drug tests and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert Oden in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Robert Oden in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plea NOT GULITY as to count 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
